Detailed Description

Exclusive code execution.

This class implements interface for Posix mutex. All errors are reported to by throwing an exception with error code contained into the error code of the exception, see Exception.

Warning:
Be careful to unlock a mutex in case of exception throwing for instance using class Util::CriticalGuard. 
    #include "kaapi"
    Foo_TYPE    gd;     // some global data 
    Util::Mutex access; // mutex to protect concurrent access to gd
    
    // Let us assume that foo may be call by concurrent threads.
    // Note that in case of exception throwed in call to compute, the
    // mutex access remains locked. One solution to this problem is to use Util::CriticalGuard
    int foo()
    {
      // avoid concurrent access to global data 'gd' using mutex 'access'
      access.lock();

      // access to the global data
      compute();

      // avoid concurrent access to global data 'gd' using mutex 'access'
      access.unlock();
    }
    
    int main()
    {
      try {
        // initialize the library and the mutex
        Util::Init::initialize();
        access.initialize();

        ...

        access.terminate();
        Util::Init::terminate();

        return 0;
      } catch (const Util::PosixError& ex) {
        std::cerr << "[Catch]:" << ex.what() << std::endl;
      } catch (const Util::Exception& ex) {
        std::cerr << "[Catch]:" << ex.what() << std::endl;
      } catch (...) {
        std::cerr << "[Catch] unknown error" << std::endl;
      }
      return -1;
    }

void Util::Mutex::lock (  )  throw (PosixError) [inline]

Lock request. Wait until access is granted. In case of success, the mutex is locked.

Exceptions:
PosixError with error code if error occurs

bool Util::Mutex::trylock (  )  throw (PosixError) [inline]

Lock if possible. If the mutex is already locked, then the method return false. The method returns true is case of success of locking the mutex.

Exceptions:
PosixError with error code if error occurs
void Util::Mutex::unlock (  )  throw (PosixError) [inline]

Unlock request. If the current thread holds the mutex, theb the method unlocks mutex. Else an exception is throwed.

Exceptions:
PosixError with error code if error occurs
